results.title: Deadly Australians. Episodes 3&4
results.brief_description: This video describes some of the most dangerous animals in Australia, and some which you would not think are dangerous! Presented by Tina Dalton, we investigate creatures found in the ‘Arid and wetland environment’, such as snakes, kangaroos and crocodiles, and ‘Perils in suburbia’, dangerous creatures that are encountered around homes and suburbs, such as spiders, ants and bees.

results.title: Deadly Australians. Episodes 1&2
results.brief_description: This video describes some of the most dangerous animals on Australia, and some which you would not think dangerous! Presented by Tina Dalton, we investigate creatures from the ‘Coastal and ocean environment’, such as Jelly fish and sharks, and from the ‘Forest environment’, such as the Cassowary and other rainforest species.

results.title: Dead to the world
results.brief_description: An impassioned battle between the conscience and corruption set in inner-city Newtown, once the boxing centre of Sydney, domain of the working class immigrants and now ripe for property development and speculation. For Alexander Polonski, owner of the districts most celebrated boxing gym, this means trouble. His gym is prime real estate and many factions are coveting it. As the story moves towards a violent climax, everyone must decide what they want, how they might get it, and just where they would draw the line in the quest for satisfaction. An innovative Australian feature film.

results.title: Dead man [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Jim Jarmusch, Demetra MacBride, 12-Gauge Productions and Pandora Films
results.brief_description: Filmed in stunning black and white by cinematographer Robby Muller, Jim Jarmusch has established a surreal tone for this visually poetic meditation on life and death. Dead Man is the tale of William Blake (Johnny Depp), a naive Ohio accountant who travels west to a primitive frontier outpost called Machine in expectation of a job that’s already been filled. Within a short space of time Blake is involved in a showdown and finds himself wounded and on the run. Pursued by vicious bounty hunters, Blake is looked after by Nobody (Gary Farmer) an Eastern-educated Indian who believes his new friend is the dead British poet and mystic William Blake. Gradually, Blake comes to fulfill his designated role as the most wanted man in this corner of the west, all the while preparing for life’s ultimate journey. Accompanied by the haunting music of Neil Young, cameo roles by Robert Mitchum, John Hurt and Iggy Pop, and a strong cast including Lance Henriksen, Michael Wincott, Mili Avital and Gabriel Byrne, makes Dead Man an experience not to be missed. Note: Widescreen format.

results.title: Dead level
results.creator_credit: Ronald Haines and British Foundation Pictures
results.brief_description: This documentary presents the various skills and craftmanship that contribute to the manufacture of a billiard table. Beginning with the preparation of the slate table top which is cut and smoothed flat before the pocket areas are chiselled out; shows the trimming and fitting of the rubber edges and the application and of the felt table top cover; presents artisans involved in the design and construction phases; shows the various performance tests that are conducted during the manufacturing process; also captures the care taken when packing the table for shipment. Finally, Sidney Smith demonstrates both basic and novelty shots on a newly crafted table. Narrated by Frank Phillips.

results.title: Days of being wild
results.creator_credit: Wong, Rover Tang and In-gear Film
results.brief_description: Wong Kar-Wai has become one of the most respected and influential filmmakers in the world since coming to prominence in the 1990s. He is a highly imaginative film stylist, whose sensuous mise-en-scene, radical editing and fragmented narratives seem aptly appropriate for an increasingly decentered postmodern world. This early film, “Days of Being Wild”, is set in 1960 and examines the relationships Yuddi (Leslie Cheung), has with three women; his courtesan adopted mother, and his two very different girlfriends (Maggie Cheung and Carina Lau). Spoilt, pampered, rich and decadent, Yuddi seems to have everything he could ask for in life, but his one real desire remains unfulfilled; to discover the identity of his natural mother. Set in a searing hot Hong Kong summer, “Days of Being Wild” is a highly erotic and cynical examination of a young bourgeois man, devoid of self-discipline, who is able to remain a “boy” through his exploitation of adoring women. In this early film, the plush warm lighting, the rich cinematography and the exuberant, playful editing already reveal the spectacular craft and the romantic sensibility that distinguishes all of Kar-Wai’s films. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Day/Night Dissolve Set, Loch Eck, Scotland, Circa 1903

constellations_primary.name: Transformations
constellations_primary.description: Like many techniques born from the visual language of magic lanterns, the dissolve effect was incorporated into filmmaking and is still used today.

results.title_for_label: Day/Night Dissolve Set, Loch Eck, Scotland, Circa 1903

results.title: Day to Day Care of Your Horse
results.brief_description: Captain Mark Phillips makes the young and fairly inexperienced horse person aware of the basic everyday care required to keep one’s horse in top condition. These requirements include: good stabling; field and fencing requirements; a daily routine of grooming etc.; exercise; and general information about veterinary care.

results.title: Day at night: I.M. Pei
results.brief_description: Interview with leading U.S. architect and designer, I.M. Pei. Covers his views on the Beaux Arts system under which he trained, his reasons for feeling that an elitist and exclusive view of architecture is no longer valid. He stresses the importance of urban housing in turning cities from places of commerce to areas offering their inhabitants a genuine richness of life
